name: Francis I

Dissolved the Holy Roman Empire after defeat at Austerlitz|
Founded the Austrian Empire from the Habsburg Monarchy|
Served as first president of German Confederation from 1815

Suffered from seizures, hydrocephaly, and speech impediment|
Considered unfit, not allowed to rule independently|
Abdicated during Revolutions of 1848 in favor of nephew

name: Franz Joseph I
JA_events:
Lost claim to Tuscany and Northern Italy|
Lost the leadership of pan-Germany (German Question) to Prussia|

Austro-Prussian War, 1866

name: Charles I
JA_events:
Abdicated immediately after the armistice of World War I|
Banished by the Austrian Parliament passing the Habsburg Law|
Attempted to reclaim Hungary, which became a republic

name: Gorm
JA_events:
Son of the semi-legendary Danish king Harthacnut|
Completed the Danevirke, a wall separating the southern Saxons

name: Harald Bluetooth
JA_events:
First ruler of a united Denmark: Jutland and Zealand|
Introduced Christianity to Denmark

name: William I
JA_events:
As Duke of Normandy, led the invading Norman forces|
Defeated King Harold Godwinson at the Battle of Hastings|
Left England to William Rufus and Normandy to Robert Curthose

Normal conquest of England, 1066|
Harrying of the North, 1068|
Revolt of the Earls, 1075

Faced a rebellion by barons who wanted a unified Norman rule|
Undermined authority of Church, exiling the Archbishop|
Killed Malcolm III, turning Scotland into an English vassal
JA_relationships: Normandy, Robert Curthose, Brother, img/france/robert_curthose.jpg

name: Henry I
JA_events:
Fought brother, Duke of Normandy, for English succession|
Encouraged to invade Normandy, imprisoning brother for life|
After son drowned, recalled daughter Matilda to be his heir
JA_relationships:

name: Stephen

Favorite nephew of Henry I, disregarded claim by aunt Matilda|
Civil war, the Anarchy, began with the invasion of Matilda's army|
Settled the war by signing a treaty naming Matilda's son his heir
JA_relationships:
Blois, Stephen, Father, img/france/stepan.jpg|
Boulogne, Matilda, Wife, img/france/matilda_boulogne.jpg

Count of Anjou through father and Aquitaine through wife|
Unpopular for murder of Archbishop and support of antipope|
Restored order following Anarchy with new judicial system

Romanticized and made popular for exploits in Third Crusade|
Vied to appoint King of Jerusalem, perhaps killing a candidate|
Captured on return and ransomed in exchange for his kingdom

name: John
JA_events:
Lost Normandy and all French holdings to French Philip II|
After a revolt of English barons, forced to seal the Magna Carta|
First king since Norman Conquest who could speak English
JA_relationships:

Scotland, Joan, Daughter, img/scotland/joan.jpg

name: Henry III
JA_events:
Inherited a country ruled by rebellious barons, loyal to France|
Financed papal wars in exchange for Sicilian crown for his son|
Forced into Provisions of Oxford, establishing privy council
JA_relationships:

name: Edward I
JA_events:
Held parliaments and made it into a feature of English politics|
Killed Llywelyn ap Gruffudd, destroying autonomy of Wales|
Arbitrated in favor of John Balliol, but invaded after he rebelled
JA_relationships:
Castille, Eleanor, Wife, img/spain/eleanor_castille.jpg|
France, Margaret, Wife, img/france/margaret.jpg

name: Edward II

Ordinances of 1311 restricted power of king's appointments|
Defeated by Robert the Bruce at Battle of Bannockburn|
Favoritism caused wife to depose him and crown their son
JA_relationships:
France, Isabella, Wife, img/france/isabella_plantagenet.jpg|
Scotland, Joan, Daughter, img/scotland/joan_of_the_tower.jpg

name: Edward III
JA_events:
Installed puppet, Edward Balliol, after death of Robert the Bruce|
Pressed claim to French throne, sparking Hundred Years' War|
During war, acquired Aquitaine but lost it and only kept Brittany
JA_wars:
Hundred Years' War, 1337-1453|
2nd War of Scottish Independence
JA_relationships: Brittany, Mary, Daughter, img/france/mary_plantagenet.jpg

name: Richard II

Succeeded grandfather after father, the Black Prince, died young|
Introduced unpopular tax to finance French war, leading to revolt|
Deposed by duke of Lancaster, whose inheritance Richard stole
JA_relationships:
Holy Roman Empire, Anne, Wife, img/hre/anne_plantagenet.jpg|

name: Henry IV

Returned from exile after Richard II stole his possessions|
Executed Archbishop of York and son of Duke of Norfolk|
Imprisoned James I of Scotland for entire reign
JA_relationships:
Denmark, Philippa, Daughter, img/denmark/philippa.jpg|

name: Henry V
JA_events:
Defeated France at Agincourt, allowing conquest of Normandy|
Taking Rouen and allying with Burgundy, France surrendered|
The Treaty of Troyes made him heir to the French throne
JA_relationships: France, Catherine of Valois, Wife, img/france/catherine_valois.jpg

name: Henry VI
JA_events:
Ascended as a minor, with power held by cousin Duke of York|
Captured by Yorkists, who demanded they name a York heir|
Routed at Yorkshire, fled to Scotland, captured, and imprisoned
JA_wars:
Hundred Years' War, 1337-1453|
Wars of the Roses, 1455-87
JA_relationships: France, Margaret of Anjou, Wife, img/france/margaret_anjou.jpg

name: Edward IV
JA_events:
Defeated the Lancastrians with help of cousin, Earl of Warwick|
Alienated Warwick and Yorkist nobles by marrying commoner|
Warwick invaded, Edward fled, and Henry Lancaster released

name: Henry VI
JA_events:
Restored to the throne from the Tower of London|
Edward IV returned and defeated Margaret's forces|
Re-imprisoned and murdered shortly afterwards
JA_relationships: France, Margaret of Anjou, Wife, img/france/margaret_anjou.jpg

name: Edward IV
JA_events:
Defeated the Lancaster forces, killing the heir at Tewkesbury|
Made peace with France in return for a generous pension|
Promiscuity led to brother Richard question the validity of sons
JA_relationships: Burgundy, Charles, Brother-in-law, img/france/charles_burgundy.jpg

name: Edward V
JA_events:
Along with brother Richard, two surviving sons of Edward IV|
Crowned at age 12 without regency, at insistence of Woodvilles|
Likely murdered in the Tower of London by uncle Richard

name: Richard III
JA_events:
Usurped power from nephew, Edward V, who 'disappeared'|
Woodvilles, family of slain nephew, rallied behind Henry Tudor|
Killed at Battle of Bosworth Field, ending the War of the Roses
JA_wars:
Wars of the Roses, 1455-87|
Buckingham's Rebellion, 1483

name: Henry VII
JA_events:
Went into exile after the defeat of the Lancastrian cause|
Married Elizabeth of York, but still faced Yorkish conspiracies|
Made peace with Spain and Scotland through careful marriages
JA_relationships:
Spain, Catherine of Aragon, Daughter-in-law, img/spain/catherine_of_aragon.jpg|
Scotland, Margaret, Daughter, img/scotland/margaret_tudor.jpg

name: Henry VIII
JA_events:
Presided over the beginnings of the English Reformation|
Unified England, Wales, and Ireland|
Married to Catherine of Aragon, Anne Boleyn, and many others

name: Edward VI
JA_events:
Devoted Protestant, ruled through regency of Earl of Warwick|
Excluded half-sisters Mary and Elizabeth from line of succession|
Convinced by Warwick to name cousin Jane Grey, a Protestant
JA_relationships: Scotland, Mary, Betrothed, img/scotland/mary.jpg

name: Jane Grey
JA_events:
Maneuvered onto the throne by her uncle, Earl of Warwick|
Overthrown by Mary Tudor with support of the populace|
Imprisoned and pardoned, but executed after Wyatt's Rebellion

name: Mary I

The first queen to rule England in her own right|
Known as Bloody Mary for her persecutions of Protestants|
Defeated Wyatt's Rebellion, but died unpopular and childless

name: Elizabeth I
JA_events:
Crafted political symbolism, establishing a cult of her virginity|
Executed Mary, Queen of Scots, to end Catholic cause|
Childless, named Protestant Scottish king James VI as her heir
JA_wars:
Anglo-Spanish War, 1585-1604|
Rising of the North, 1569|
Conquest of Ireland, 1594-1603

name: James I
JA_events:
Clashed with English Parliament over his idea of absolutism|
Authorized English translation of bible, the King James Version|
Faced an assassination by Guy Fawkes, the Gunpowder Plot

name: Charles I

Quarreled with Parliament, provoking the English Civil War|
After six years of war, captured, put on trial, and executed|

JA_wars:
First Bishops' War, 1639-40|
English Civil War, 1642-8

name: Charles II

Fighting for his father, escaped to France after losing to Cromwell|
With no good successor to Cromwell, restored by Parliament|
Secretly converted to Catholicism for French help against Dutch
JA_relationships:

name: James II

Converted to Catholicism and repealed anti-Catholic laws|
Ordered bishops to offer indulgences, leading to public protests|
Protestant nobles invited William of Orange to come take throne

name: William III
JA_events:
Seen by Protestants as a hero, saving Europe from the French|
Faced Irish rebellions, the Jacobites, supporting James II|
Passed the Act of Settlement, excluding Catholics from throne

name: Anne
JA_events:
Relied heavily on ministers, who led the war effort|
Supported Tories, then Whigs, swayed by her current favorites|
Succession passed over 57 candidates to Protestant Hanovers
JA_relationships: Denmark, Prince George, Husband, img/denmark/george.jpg

name: George I
JA_events:
Supported by Whigs over James Stuart, The Old Pretender|
Unable to speak English, relied on Walpole, first Prime Minister|
Embroiled in controversy over collapse of South Sea Company
JA_relationships:
Holy Roman Empire, Ernest Augustus, Father, img/hre/ernest_augustus.jpg|
Prussia, Sophia Dorothea, Wife, img/hre/sophia_dorothea.jpg

name: George II
JA_events:
Through John Carteret, joined the War of Austrian Succession|
Accused of supporting his German holdings over England|
Largely observed ministers leading Seven Years' War in France
JA_wars:

Lost American colonies to revolution, but united with Ireland|
Fought with Revolutionary France to retain hold on aristocracy
JA_relationships: Holy Roman Empire, Charlotte of Mecklenburg-Strelitz, Wife, img/hre/charlotte_mecklenburg.jpg

Served as regent during father's period of madness|
Catholic Emancipation removed restrictions on Catholics|
Retiring from politics, was known as an astute patron of the arts

name: William IV

Oversaw the abolition of slavery, child labor, and welfare|
Childless, British crown went to Victoria; Hanoverian to brother
JA_relationships:

JA_events:
Indian Rebellion causes British East India Company to dissolve|
Through Prince Albert, descended much of European royalty|
Solidified holdings in Suez Canal, Cyprus, and across Africa

Immensely popular, known as the "Uncle of Europe"|
Excluded from cabinet by mother who disapproved of affairs|
Helped enact the Parliament Act, limiting the House of Lords

JA_relationships:

name: Edward VIII
JA_events:
Voluntarily abdicated in order to marry American divorcee|
Implicated in plot to restore him to throne as a Nazi agent|
Governer of The Bahamas, then lived in Paris after the war

name: George VI
JA_events:
Supported appeasement policy towards Germany until Churchill|
Ceased to be emperor of India and Pakistan after independence|
Oversaw British Empire turn into Commonwealth of Nations

name: Elizabeth II
JA_events:
Married her cousin, Philip Mountbatten of Greece and Denmark|
Allowed television crews into domestic life, modernizing family|
Plays a completely ceremonial role, staying out of politics

name: Pepin the Short
JA_events:
Pushed out powerless Merovingian king with blessing of Pope|
Donated Lombardi land to the pope, establishing Papal States|
Annointed Patrician of the Romans by Pope Stephen II

name: Carloman I
JA_events:
Received the eastern part of Pepin's lands|
Competed against Charlemagne for complete control of territory|
After death, Charlemagne annexed his territory as sole ruler

name: Charlemagne
JA_events:
Conquered and Christianized the Saxons and Frisians|
Invaded Italy on appeal from Pope, assuming Lombard crown|
Crowned Emperor of the Romans for securing Christian borders
JA_relationships: Lombards, Desiderius, Father-in-law, img/italy/desiderius.jpg

name: Louis the Pious
JA_events:
As king of Aquitaine, served as co-emperor with his father|
Attempted to keep empire together and repeal debauchery|
Upon his death, civil war broke out and empire split three ways
JA_relationships: Bavaria, Welf, Father-in-law, img/hre/welf_i.jpg

name: Charles the Bald
JA_events:
Received western part of father's empire inTreaty of Verdun|
Lost Brittany but won the Aquitaine and western Lorraine|
Crowned Emperor of the Romans after death of nephew Louis II

name: Louis II
JA_events:
Declined the crown of Emperor of the Romans|
Agreed to truce with ruler of East Francia, Louis the Younger|
After death, land divided between sons Carloman II and Louis III

name: Louis III
JA_events:
Received Neustria and Francia from father Louis II|
With brother Carloman II, repelled Scandinavian invaders|
Ceded western Lotharingia to Louis the Younger of East Francia

name: Carloman II
JA_events:
Received Burgundy & Aquitaine from father Louis II|
Tried unsuccessfully to defeat usurper of Provence, Boso

name: Charles the Fat
JA_events:
Received East Francia after death of brother, Louis the Younger|
Received West Francia after deaths of Louis and Carloman|
Seen as incompetent, deposed in East Francia by Arnulf

name: Odo
JA_events:
As Count of Paris, successfully defended against viking raiders|
Elected King of the Franks after deposition of Charles the Fat|
First king who was not of Merovingian or Carolingian blood

name: Charles III
JA_events:
Ceded Normandy to Vikings in return for conversion and fealty|
Received Lotharingia after death of Louis the Child|
Killed usurper Robert but taken prisoner by Robert's son-in-law

name: Robert I
JA_events:
Younger brother to Odo, defeated Northmen at Chartres|
Elected king with support of dissident nobles and East Francia|
Victorious at Battle of Soissons but killed in the battle

name: Rudolph
JA_events:
Son-in-law of Robert I, who was killed overthrowing Charles III|
Made peace with Normans, granting them the Channel Islands|
Lost Lorraine to Henry I and Laon to Herbert, captor of Charles

name: Louis IV
JA_events:
Spent his reign stuggling against vassal, Hugh the Great|
Defended against invasion by Hugh who had support of Otto I|
Captured and imprisoned by Hugh, who was excommunicated
JA_relationships:
England, Edward the Elder, Grandfather, img/england/edward_the_elder.jpg|
Germany, Otto I, Brother-in-law, img/hre/otto_i.jpg

name: Lothair III

Broke German alliance and spent reign fighting over Lorraine|
Attempted to capture Otto II's family, prompting German Invasion|
Defended with help of Hugh Capet, grandson of Hugh the Great

name: Louis V
JA_events:
Married widow of Aquitaine but lost it and failed to retake it|
Unpopular uncle, Charles, passed over in favor of Hugh Capet|
Last Carolingian King of Francia

name: Hugh Capet
JA_events:
First of a direct line of 15 Capetian kings of France|
Son of Hugh the Great and grandson of Robert I|
Faced internal struggles, but son acceeded without difficulty

name: Robert II
JA_events:
Brought Burgundy back under Frankish control for brief period|
Pressed claim to fiefs as they became vacant, consolidating hold
JA_relationships: Italy, Rozala, Wife, img/italy/rozala.jpg

name: Henry I
JA_events:
Favored then fought William the Conquerer, Duke of Normandy|
Signed decree of friendship with Henry III, Holy Roman Emperor|
Civil war fought with younger brother, who was given Burgundy
JA_relationships:
England, William the Conquerer, Nephew, img/england/william_the_conquerer.png|

JA_events:
Supported Robert Curthose, Duke of Normandy, against England|
Drawn into conflict with papacy for selling ecclesiastical positions|
Added the Vexin and Bourges to Frankish rule

name: Louis VI
JA_events:
Contested the Vexin against Henry I of England|
Repelled German invasion, who marched under French banner|
Added Aquitaine to Francia by marrying Eleanor to his son

name: Louis VII
JA_events:
Marriage to Eleanor annulled, losing Aquitaine to England|
Fought Henry II, Duke of Normandy and later King of England|
Supported English Thomas Becket, Archbishop of Canterbury
JA_relationships:
Aquitaine, Eleanor, Wife, img/france/eleanor.jpg|
Castille, Constance, Wife, img/spain/constance.jpg

name: Philip II
JA_events:
Participated in Third Crusade with Richard I of England|
Reclaimed French land from Angevin Empire of John I|
Left France rich, paving the way for greatness in 13th century

name: Louis VIII
JA_events:
Offered English throne by rebellious English barons|
Recaptured fortress of Avignon from Albigensian heretics|
Developed concept of fealty sworn to throne, not the individual

name: Louis IX
JA_events:
Prevented English Henry III from reclaiming Angevin land|
Created provosts, bailiffs, and presumption of innocence|
Captured and ransomed during Seventh Crusade

name: Philip III
JA_events:
Annexed Toulouse to the French crown|
Married son to heiress of Navarre, Champagne, and Brie|
Fought the Aragonese, who opposed Angevin rule of Sicily

name: Philip IV

Fought England over Gascony and later Flanders for treachery|
Clement V, a Gascon, moved papacy from Rome to Avignon|
Attempted to have brother and son elected Holy Roman Emperor

name: Louis X
JA_events:
Married daughter of Burgundy, who he imprisoned for adultery|
Allowed serfs to buy freedom, beginning the end of serfdom|
Attempted to raise money through charters to fund Flemish war

name: John I
JA_events:
Born posthumously to Louis X|
Died 5 days after birth, with throne going to uncle Philip V

name: Philip V
JA_events:
Succession of Philip, over neice, set precedent for Salic law|
Created independent Court of Finances and single currency|
Created standardization of weights and measures

name: Charles IV

Invaded the Aquitaine, held by his vassal Edward II of England|
Failed in bid for German throne and acquisition of Flanders|
Died without heir, ending Capetian line, succeeded by cousin

Resentment carried to Edward III, who had a claim to throne|

name: John II

Inherited English war, breaking a truce and then losing terribly|
Defeated and taken prisoner at Poitiers by The Black Prince|
Released for hostages, returned to England when one escaped

name: Charles V

Treaty of Calais had granted southwestern France to Edward III|
Recaptured all ceded territories and dispossesed King of Navarre|

Attempted to install Avignon antipope Clement VII in Rome|

Disinherited by father in favor of Henry V of England|
Reclaimed Paris and northern France with help of Joan of Arc|

Hundred Years' War, 1337-1453|
Armagnac-Burgundian Civil War

Faced an alliance of Burgundy, Brittany, and England|
Dismantled alliance, finally killing Duke of Burgundy in battle|

Duke of Orleans, second-cousin and brother-in-law to king|

name: Peter III
JA_events:
Nephew to Elizabeth, first of Holstein-Gottorp-Romanov house|
A progressive, granted religion freedom and abolished secret police|
Overthrown by wife Princess Sophie, who became Catherine II
JA_relationships: Sweden, Charles Frederick, Father, img/hre/charles_frederick.jpg

name: Catherine II
JA_events:
Oversaw the breakup of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth|
Gained Crimea and Poland; colonized Novorossia and Alaska|
An enlightened absolutist, brought about an artistic renaissance
JA_wars:
Russo-Turkish Wars, 1768-74|
Polish-Russian War, 1792|
Russo-Persian War, 1795
JA_relationships:
Poland, Stanislaw II, Lover, img/poland/stanislaw_ii.jpg|
Sweden, Gustave IV Adolf, Cousin, img/sweden/gustav_iv_adolf.jpg

name: Paul I
JA_events:
Added eastern Georgia to the empire|
Allied with Britain and Austria against Napeolonic France|
Creating policies unfriendly to nobles, was assassinated by military
JA_relationships:
Prussia, Frederick II Eugene, Father-in-law, img/germany/frederick_eugene.jpg|
Netherlands, William II, Son-in-law, img/dutch/william_ii.jpg

name: Alexander I
JA_events:
King of Poland and Grand Duke of Finland during unity periods|
Napoleon's army collapsed during invasion, losing 500,000 men|
Joined Holy Alliance with Austria and Prussia to combat revolutions
JA_wars:
Anglo-Russian War, 1807-1812|
Finnish War, Sweden, 1808-9|
Russo-Persian War, 1804-13

name: Nicholas I
JA_events:
Seized the last territories in the Caucasus held by Persia|
Lost Crimean War and influence over Romania, Serbia, & Black Sea|
On eve of death, Russian territory was at its zenith: 8MM sq. miles
JA_wars:
Russo-Persian War, 1826-28|
Greek War of Independence|
Crimean War, Ottomans, 1853-6
JA_relationships:
Denmark, Frederick William, Son-in-law, img/denmark/frederick_william.jpg|
Prussia, Frederick William III, Father-in-law, img/germany/frederick_william_iii.jpg

name: Alexander II
JA_events:
Emancipated Russian serfs, for which he is known as The Liberator|
Sold Alaska to the United States to prevent it from becoming British|
Pursued further expansion into Siberia, Caucasus, and Turkestain
JA_relationships:
German Confederation, Louis II, Father-in-law, img/germany/louis_ii.jpg|
German Empire, Alfred, Son-in-law, img/germany/alfred.jpg|
Greece, Alexandra, Daughter-in-law, img/greece/alexandra.jpg

name: Alexander III
JA_events:
A counter-reformer, reversed many of his father's policies|
Formed Triple Entente alliance with France and Great Britain|
JA_relationships:
Denmark, Christian IX, Father-in-law, img/denmark/christian_ix.jpg|
England, Edward VII, Brother-in-law, img/england/edward_vii.jpg|
Greece, George I, Brother-in-law, img/greece/george_i.jpg

name: Nicholas II
JA_events:
Lost influence over Manchuria and Korea to the Japanese|
Lost 3.3 million Russians during World War I, causing revolution|
Abdicated, imprisoned, and handed over to Bolsheviks for execution
JA_relationships:
Denmark, Christian IX, Grandfather, img/denmark/christian_ix.jpg|
Greece, Constantine I, Cousin, img/greece/constantine_i.jpg|
Germany, Wilhelm II, Cousin, img/germany/wilhelm_ii.jpg

name: Malcolm III
JA_events:
Lived in exile during reign of Macbeth, his father's killer|
After Norman conquest, gave refuge to Edgar the theling|
Attempted conquest of Northumbria, dying in battle to William II
JA_relationships: England, Edgar thling, Brother-in-law, img/england/edgar_aethling.jpg

name: Donald Bane
JA_events:
Beseiged Edinburgh Castle with support of Celtic Scots|
Expelled by nephew Duncan II with support of English and Normans

name: Duncan II
JA_events:
Grew up as English hostage, as father's homage to William I|
Deposed uncle Donald Bane, who then had him killed
JA_relationships: England, Edgar thling, Uncle, img/england/edgar_aethling.jpg

name: Donald Bane
JA_events:
Had nephew Duncan II killed after just a few months|
Deposed by an English army led by Edgar the theling|
Replaced by other nephew, Edgar, son of Malcolm III

name: Edgar
JA_events:
Placed on Scottish throne with aid of William II of England|
First Scottish king to have Celtic and Anglo-Saxon ancestry|
Ceded the Hebrides to Magnus III of Norway
JA_relationships: England, Edgar thling, Uncle, img/england/edgar_aethling.jpg

name: Alexander I
JA_events:
Allowed younger brother, David, to rule southern Scotland|
Likely acknolwedged Henry I of England has his overlord|
Attempted to preserve the independence of the Scottish Church
JA_relationships:
England, Henry I, Father-in-law, img/england/henry_i.png|
England, Edgar thling, Uncle, img/england/edgar_aethling.jpg

name: David I
JA_events:
Supported his niece, Empress Matilda, over Stephen of Blois|
Granted Northumbria and Cumbria for fighting in The Anarchy|
Annexed the Mormaer of Moray to the Scottish crown|
JA_relationships: England, Henry I, Brother-in-law, img/england/henry_i.png

name: Malcolm IV
JA_events:
Ascended throne at age of 11, grandson of David I|
Forced to give Northumbria and Cumbria back to Henry II|
Succeeded by his brother, William the Lion

name: William I
JA_events:
Revolted to win back Northumbria but captured by Henry II|
As part of release, confirmed the supremacy of English Church|
Bought release of feudal subjection from Richard I

name: Alexander II
JA_events:
Supported the English barons' revolt, hoping to reclaim land|
Established Anglo-Scottish border through the Treaty of York
JA_relationships: England, Henry III, Brother-in-law, img/england/henry_iii.png

name: Alexander III
JA_events: Gained Isle of Man and Hebrides from Norwegian Haakon IV
JA_relationships: England, Henry III, Father-in-law, img/england/henry_iii.png

name: Margaret
JA_events:
Only surviving descendant of grandfather, Alexander III|
Sailed from Norway to take crown, but died en route|
Her death led to thirteen claims to the throne, the Great Cause
JA_relationships:
Norway, Eric II, Father, img/norway/eric_ii.jpg|
England, Edward II, Betrothed, img/england/edward_ii.jpg

name: John
JA_events:
Selected among competitors during Great Cause|
Deposed by Scottish nobility who'd signed a treaty with France|
Imprisoned in Tower of London and exiled to Papal States

name: Robert I
JA_events:
Claimed throne while under rule of Edward I of England|
Defeated the English at the Battle of Bannockburn|
Finally made peace with England after deposition of Edward II
JA_relationships: Ireland, Elizabeth de Burgh, Wife, img/ireland/elizabeth_de_burgh.jpg

name: David II
JA_events:
Sent to France for safety after losing the Battle of Halidon Hill|
Captured by the English and held for 11 years|
JA_relationships: England, Joan of the Tower, Wife, img/england/joan_of_the_tower.jpg

name: Robert II
JA_events:
Defeated the return of Edward Balliol and the English|
Included Scotland in the Anglo-French truce of 1384

name: Robert III
JA_events:
Albany Stewart, his brother, had effective control over kingdom|
Son David captured and killed by Albany|
Other son, James, fled to France but was captured by Henry IV

name: James I
JA_events:
While a captive of Henry IV, raised in the English court|
Arrested the Lord of the Isles and the Douglas clan leaders|
Was murdered during a failed coup by uncle, Walter Stewart
JA_relationships: France, Louis XI, Son-in-law, img/france/louis_xi.jpg

name: James II
JA_events:
Murdered Earl of Douglas for consipiring with Lord of the Isles|
Killed by friendly fire during the seige of an English castle
JA_relationships: Flanders, Mary of Guelders, Wife, img/france/mary_guelders.jpg

name: James III
JA_events:
Received Orkney and Shetland Islands as dowry from Norway|
Imprisoned by Edward IV in Edinburgh Castle|
Killed during a rebellion at the Battle of Sauchieburn
JA_relationships: Denmark, Margaret, Wife, img/denmark/margaret.jpg

name: James IV
JA_events:
Defeated his father, James III, at the Battle of Sauchieburn|
Signed the Treaty of Perpetual Peace with Henry VII|
Took away the Lord of the Isles title from the MacDonalds
JA_wars: War of the League of Cambrai
JA_relationships:
England, Margaret Tudor, Wife, img/england/margaret_tudor.jpg|
Denmark, Christian I, Grandfather, img/denmark/christian_i.jpg

name: James V
JA_events:
Imprisoned by his stepfather Archibald Douglas for 3 years|
Persecuted Protestants during the Scottish Reformation|
His death left the infant Mary, Queen of Scots as the heir
JA_relationships:
England, Henry VIII, Uncle, img/england/henry_viii.jpg|
France, Madeleine, Wife, img/france/madeleine_valois.jpg|
France, Mary of Guise, Wife, img/france/mary_guise.jpg

name: Mary, Queen of Scots
JA_events:
Arriving from France, imprisoned by Protestants and deposed|
Believed by English Catholics to be the legitimate heir to Mary I|
After 18 years in English custody, beheaded by Elizabeth I
JA_relationships:
France, Francis II, Husband, img/france/francis_ii.jpg|
England, Edward VI, Betrothed, img/england/edward_vi.jpg

name: James VI
JA_events:
Taken from Mary, Queen of Scots and raised as a Protestant|
Ingratiated himself to the childless Elizabeth I to be named her heir|
Colonized the Hebrides in an attempt to de-gaelicise it
JA_relationships:
Holy Roman Empire, Frederick V, Son-in-law, img/hre/frederick_v.jpg|
Spain, Infanta Maria Anna, Attempted match, img/spain/maria_anna.jpg|
Denmark, Anne, Wife, img/denmark/anne.jpg

name: Philip II
JA_events:
King of England and Ireland through marriage to Mary Tudor|
Ruled during the Spanish Golden Age, the height of Spanish power|
Sent the Spanish Armada to England to place a Catholic on the throne
JA_wars:
French Wars of Religion, 1562-98|
Dutch War of Independence|
Anglo-Spanish War, 1585-1604
JA_relationships:
England, Mary I, Wife, img/england/mary_i.png|
France, Henry II, Father-in-law, img/france/henry_ii.jpg|
Holy Roman Empire, Maximilian II, Brother-in-law, img/hre/maximilian_ii.jpg

name: Philip III
JA_events:
Expelled 300,000 Moriscos, Christiantized descendants of the Moors|
Famine, poor taxation, and debt led to the economic decline of Spain|
Intervened against German Protestants at the start of Thirty Years' War
JA_wars:
Dutch War of Independence|
Anglo-Spanish War, 1585-1604|
Thiry Years' War, 1618-48
JA_relationships:
Holy Roman Empire, Ferdinand II, Brother-in-law, img/hre/ferdinand_ii.jpg|
France, Louis XIII, Son-in-law, img/france/louis_xiii.jpg

name: Philip IV
JA_events:
Acknowledged independence of the Dutch Republic|
Lost Flanders and Northern Catalonia to the French|
Portugal removes itself from union, crowning John IV
JA_wars:
Thiry Years' War, 1618-48|
Spanish-French War, 1635-59|
Portuguese Restoration War
JA_relationships: France, Henry IV, Father-in-law, img/france/henry_iv.jpg

name: Charles II
JA_events:
Sterile, lame, epileptic, senile, and always on the verge of death|
Named the French Philip of Anjou as his successor|
Succession crisis leads to war between Bourbons and Habsburgs
JA_relationships:
Austria, Maria Anna, Aunt/grandmother, img/spain/maria_anna.jpg|
Austria, Mariana, Mother/cousin, img/spain/mariana.jpg|
Spain, Philip III, Grandfather/great-grandfather, img/spain/philip_iii.jpg

name: Philip V
JA_events:
Grandson of French king, who hoped to secure throne for himsef|
War ended with a treaty forbidding France and Spain from unifying|
Failed to reclaim lost territories of Sicily and Sardinia
JA_wars:
War of the Spanish Succession|
War of the Quadruple Alliance
JA_relationships:
France, Louis XIV, Grandfather, img/france/louis_xiv.jpg|
Italy, Maria Luisa, Wife, img/spain/maria_luisa.jpg|
Portugal, Joseph I, Son-in-law, img/portugal/joseph_i.png

name: Louis I
JA_events:
Father Philip abdicated, possibly to press claim for French throne|
Died after only seven months as king

name: Philip V
JA_events: Came back to throne because younger son, Ferdinand, was not of age
JA_wars:
War of the Polish Succession|
War of the Austrian Succession
JA_relationships:
France, Louis XIV, Grandfather, img/france/louis_xiv.jpg|
Italy, Maria Luisa, Wife, img/spain/maria_luisa.jpg|
Portugal, Joseph I, Son-in-law, img/portugal/joseph_i.png

name: Ferdinand VI
JA_events:
Reformed taxation, which had heavily taxed Castile|
Fought with Portugal over the colony of Sacramento in Uruguay|
Died without issue, giving crown to younger brother Charles III
JA_relationships: Portugal, John V, Father-in-law, img/portugal/john_v.jpg

name: Charles III
JA_events:
Won throne of Sicily and Naples through war of Polish succession|
Succeeded to Spanish throne after death of older brother|
Lost colonies to Britain, reclaiming them after American Revolution
JA_wars:
War of the Polish Succession|
War of the Austrian Succession|
Seven Years' War, 1756-63
JA_relationships:
Italy, Elizabeth Farnese, Mother, img/italy/elisabeth_farnese.jpg|
Portugal, Mariana Victoria, Daughter-in-law, img/portugal/mariana_victoria.jpg|
Holy Roman Empire, Leopold II, Son-in-law, img/hre/leopold_ii.jpg

name: Charles IV
JA_events:
Switched sides between France and Britain during Napoleonic Wars|
Grew deeply unpopular and son Ferdinand attempted a failed coup|
Popular revolt forced Charles to abdicate in favor of Ferdinand
JA_relationships: Italy, Maria Luisa, Wife, img/italy/maria_luisa.jpg

name: Ferdinand VII
JA_events:
Ascended throne during popular revolt against father Charles IV|
Turned to Napoleon for support, who then imprisoned him in France

name: Joseph Bonaparte
JA_events:
Ascended throne after being King of Naples and Sicily|
Unpopularly seen as secular, a foreigner, and a Freemason|
Returned to France after the defeat of Napoleon's forces

name: Ferdinand VII
JA_events:
Re-installed by Bonaparte through the Treaty of Valenay|
Napoleonic-era Congress of 1812 pressed for constitutional monarchy|
Captured by partisans but freed by French Bourbon intervention

name: Isabella II
JA_events:
Contested by Carlists who refused to recognize a female heir|
Replaced during Glorious Revolution with son of Italian king|
Would-be Prussian heir caused France to declare war on Prussia
JA_wars:
Carlist Wars, 1833-49|
Hispano-Moroccan War, 1859|
Chincha Islands War, 1864-6
JA_relationships:
Two Sicilies, Francis I, Grandfather, img/italy/francis_i.jpg|
Spain, Francisco de Paula, Uncle and father-in-law, img/spain/francisco_de_paula.jpg

name: Amadeo I
JA_events:
Installed by military council, then contested by the Carlists|
With no popular support, abdicated after assassination attempt|
After abdication, Spain was proclaimed the First Spanish Republic
JA_relationships: Italy, Victor Emmanuel II, Father, img/italy/victor_emmanuel_ii.jpg

name: Alfonso XII
JA_events:
Returned from exile following a military coup against the Republic|
Defeated the Carlist pretender Charles V, ending the Carlist revolts
JA_relationships: Two Sicilies, Don Carlos, Son-in-law, img/italy/carlos_two_sicilies.jpg

name: Alfonso XIII
JA_events:
Born posthumously to Alfonso XII; regency held by mother|
Lost rule over Cuba, Puerto Rico, Guam, and the Philippines|
Abdicated after municipal elections signaled the end of monarchy
JA_relationships:
Austria, Maria Christina, Mother, img/austria/maria_christina.jpg|
England, Victoria Eugenie, Wife, img/spain/victoria_eugenia.jpg

name: Francisco Franco
JA_events:
Decorated military general in the years before the Second Republic|
Led the far-right forces to victory in the Spanish Civil War|
A repressive fascist, styled himself Caudillo & re-established monarchy|
Following economic boom, Spanish Miracle, began to support liberalization|
Without heir, named conservative grandson of Alfonso XIII his successor
JA_wars:
Spanish Civil War, 1936-9|
Ifni War, Morocco, 1957-8

name: Juan Carlos I
JA_events:
Dismantled Francoist regime, creating democracy and constitution|
Reconfirmed support for democracy after foiling Francoist coup|
Following a series of family scandals, abdicated in favor of his son
JA_relationships: Greece, Sofia, Wife, img/greece/sofia.jpg
